e4: Adopting the new policy promotes ethical transparency, mitigating legal risks and potentially strengthening investor trust long-term. Although there may be initial confusion among some investors who are accustomed to adjusting earnings, clear and consistent communication during the transition can mitigate these issues. Upholding the highest standards in financial reporting supports corporate integrity and could enhance the company's reputation among stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should exhibit accuracy, transparency, and consistency. It must accurately reflect the company's financial performance without any intentional bias or manipulation. Transparency is crucial for ensuring that all stakeholders have a clear understanding of the financial health of the company. Consistency in reporting practices helps build trust and credibility over time. Ethical considerations must also include fair access to information for all investors, preventing an information advantage that could benefit more sophisticated investors disproportionately over retail investors.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to clearly communicate the change in reporting policy to all stakeholders, especially retail investors, and what measures are in place to ensure a smooth transition. Additionally, I would inquire about any potential impacts on the stock price and investor relations in the short and long term resulting from this policy shift.
